creditline: Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr.

makers.displaydate: 1880–1946; born Canandaigua, NY; died Huntington, NY
makers.displaymaker: Arthur Garfield Dove, 1880–1946; born Canandaigua, NY; died Huntington, NY

texts.textentryhtml: Dove worked in a variety of media, using spare forms to conjure a sense of place rather than to document his immediate surroundings. This earth‑toned watercolor depicts one of the many barges he observed between 1924 and 1933, when he lived on Long Island, often on a houseboat. Executed quickly with thin, layered brushstrokes over skeletal chalk lines, it served as a preliminary sketch for the oil painting Red Barge. Both works were exhibited together in 1932 at Alfred Stieglitz’s gallery An American Place, where the gallerist featured watercolors in this distinctive American style. Former Princeton University Art Museum director Frank Jewett Mather Jr. purchased the piece there in 1944.
An American Place, New York, 1932; Frank Jewett Mather Jr.
